Articles.Content:
Hi, TP here!

Just two planes I built last week, they are not really that fancy or interesting other then the high part count. My idea was to make a modular design which allowed an indefinite number of modules to be combined according to your own needs. May need some more work, will see if I can find the time for it.

The "Maelstrum" is an upgrade from the original "Yag Saron";

- Less parts

- Less tonnage.*

- More agility

- More speed.

- More fuel capacity.(optional)*

*When refering to less tonnage I mean the overall capacity/payload of fuel has increased compared to the total weight.

Q&A

Q: Do these things even take off from the runway?

A: Yes, thou the Yag Saron may touch some grassland after it runs out of runway.

-

Q: Whats next?

A: A more modular design with a set number of engines pr module, including intakes, struts, girders and wings.

Maelstrum(824P/300T)

Yag Saron(970P/310T)

Edited July 13, 2014 by TimePeriod
Clerfication
